div.head: Curing dogs of mange
div.ab: Give them a pill of precipitate, that is to say iii or 4, or up to 5 grains, mixed with their meat. Having given it to them one one week, give them another seven or eight days after.

div.head: Excellent mustard
div.ab: Dry bread in an oven, then lard it with cloves & cinnamon & thus put it to soak in good wine. Then, pass everything through a tammy cloth, being well crushed, & incorporate it with your mustard seed.

div.head: Keeping birds and animals
div.ab: skin them Take a measurement of their body, which is fleshy & more subject to decay, with some canvas that you will cut from their size & width. And having cou filled it with cotton & sewn it, skin them, birds leaving however the head, the neck, the wings & the feet on the birds, & the head, the legs & the feet & tail on the animals, because those dry easily.
